ccg-setinfo.name: Fractured Time
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: Temporal Misalignment
card.text: Consume: X. (Your opponent chooses a number of cards to take from the top of his or her dilemma pile and places them face up beneath this mission.) Randomly select X personnel to be stopped.

card.name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine
card.text: Place this dilemma on this mission. Your opponent names a skill. Each of your personnel who has that skill is attributes-2. At the end of this turn, this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Tragic Turn
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Place this dilemma on this mission (limit one per mission). When a personnel at this mission is stopped by another dilemma, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. When a personnel at this mission is kileld by another dilemma, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Cardassian Protectorate
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command three {car} personnel. Plays in your core. When you spend 1 counter to draw a card, instead examine the top three cards of your deck, place one of them on this event, and take the other two into hand.

card.name: Expand the Collective
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {bor} personnel. Plays on your {AQ} mission worth 35 or fewer points. You may attempt and complete it using your {bor} personnel with these requirements: {P} - Anthropology, Biology, Security, Transporters, and Strength>32; {S} - Astrometrics, Engineer, Physics, Science, and Cunning>36. When you complete it, destroy this event to score 5 points.

card.name: Heightened Perception
card.text: Temporal. Plays in your core. When you choose dilemmas for your dilemma stack, you may place any you do not choose face down on this event. When an opponent has faced the last dilemma in your dilemma stack, you may examine your dilemmas here and place one on your dilemma stack. When a mission attempt ends, return each dilemma here to your dilemma pile.

card.name: Medical Teams
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When your {DS9} personnel is about to be killed by a dilemma, you may place him or her on this event instead. When this event is destroyed, you may place each personnel here at your headquarters mission.

card.name: Noble Cause
card.text: Decay: 2. (When there are two cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command three {kli} personnel. Plays in your core. When you destroy an Assault or Maneuver event you own, you may place it on this event. When this event is destroyed, you may take each card here into your hand.

card.name: Out of Options
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. When an opponent begins a mission attempt, examine his or her hand and choose a card to place on this event. When this event is destroyed, return each card here to its owner's hand.

card.name: Quantum Incursions
card.text: Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, if you command an {AU} personnel, you may choose any number of cards in your hand and set them aside face down. Draw an equal number of cards, then put the cards you set aside on top of your deck in any order.

card.name: Quarantine
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Q. Plays in your core. When your dilemma is about to be overcome, place it on this event instead. When you lose command of this event, the player on your right places all dilemmas here face up beneath his or her mission.

card.name: Security Drills
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, you may place a {fed} card from hand on this event to make that personnel gain a skill he or she already has until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Spreading Fear
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Place a card from hand on this event to begin an engagement involving your Jem'Hadar. If you win, randomly select one opponent's personnel involved for each of your Vorta involved. Choose one of those selected personnel to be killed.

card.name: Tampering With Time
card.text: Temporal. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may choose one: stop one of your {Fut} personnel to examine the top three cards of an opponent’s dilemma pile; or stop one of your {Pa} personnel to examine the bottom three cards of an opponent’s dilemma pile. Place those cards on the top and/or bottom of that dilemma pile in any order.

card.name: Temporal Test Subject
card.text: Temporal. Discard an {AU}, {Fut}, or {Pa} personnel from hand to take an {AU}, {Fut}, or {Pa} personnel from your discard pile into hand. Destroy this event.

card.name: The Edge of Forever
card.text: Temporal. Plays in your core. Order - Lose 5 points to choose one: download a {Fut} card and place it at your headquarters mission where it could be played; or take a {Pa} card from your discard pile and place it at your headquarters mission where it could be played. Destroy this event.

card.name: The Play's the Thing
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When you play this event, chose {AU}, {Fut}, or {Pa}. Each personnel you own who costs 3 or more gains that icon. At the start of each of your turns, place a card from hand on this event.

card.name: Unyielding
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When your {bor} personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may place a {bor} personnel from hand on this event to prevent that.

card.name: Explicit Orders
card.text: When your {dom} personnel is attempting a mission, discard a {dom} personnel of a different species from hand to make him or her gain the discarded personnel’s skills until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Fitting In
card.text: When your personnel is facing a dilemma, choose one for him or her to gain until the end of that dilemma: an attribute from a {Fut} personnel present; or a skill from a {Pa} personnel present.

card.name: Collapse Anti-Time Anomaly
card.text: Astrometrics, Engineer, Leadership, Physics, and Cunning>36 Region: Neutral Zone. When your personnel attempt this mission, if there are no dilemmas overcome beneath it, you may download a Q card.

card.name: Kira Nerys (The Intendant)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Intelligence {SD}Leadership {SD}Transporters {SD}2 Treachery Order - Remove a card in your discard pile from the game to download a copy of that card. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Kira Taban (Husband and Father)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Honor {SD}Medical {SD}Physics Bajoran Resistance. When you play this personnel, if you have a lower score than each of your opponents, score 5 points.

card.name: Dukat (Prefect of Bajor)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}2 Treachery Gul. When this personnel or a {car} personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard a non-{car} personnel from hand to prevent that. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Elim Garak (First Officer of Terok Nor)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Officer {SD}Programming {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery When a personnel at this mission is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may kill your captive to prevent that.

card.name: Borath (Subconscious Projection)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Medical {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery Founder. Order - Stop your Jem'Hadar present to reveal the top card of your deck and an opponent's deck. If they are the same card type, draw yours and discard the opponent's

card.name: Founder Agitator (Elusive Assassin)
card.text: {SD}Physics {SD}Science {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery Assassin. Founder. Infiltrator. Shape-shifter. Order - Return this personnel to his owner's hand to return one opponent's non-unique personnel present to his or her owner's hand for each headquarters mission that opponent commands.

card.name: James T. Kirk (Living Legend)
card.text: {SD}2 Honor {SD}Leadership While this personnel is facing a dilemma that has requirements you cannot meet, you may kill this personnel to prevent any further effects of that dilemma and overcome it.

card.name: Tasha Yar (Tactical Officer)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Security While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may place her on top of her owner's deck to prevent one of your personnel present from being stopped by dilemmas until the end of this turn.

card.name: Worf (First Officer)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard two cards from hand to exchange a {TNG} personnel you own present with a {TNG} personnel who has the same cost from your hand.

card.name: Korath (Duplicitous Tinkerer)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Physics High Council Member. When you play a non-Hand Weapon equipment, you may destroy and event that has no cards on it.

card.name: Worf (Regent of the Alliance)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Leadership {SD}2 Treachery Chancellor. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a {car} or {kli} personnel from hand to make this personnel attributes+3 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Benjamin Sisko (Outlaw)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation Order - Choose one for this personnel to gain: Honor personnel present are Cunning +1; or Treachery personnel present are Cunning +1. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

card.name: Daniels (Temporal Enforcer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Engineer {SD}Intelligence {SD}Physics {SD}Security When this personnel is killed, shuffle him into his owner's deck.

card.name: Miles O'Brien ('Smiley')
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Physics {SD}Transporters When you play a ship at this mission, if you have played no other ships this turn, it is cost-1 for each of your Engineer personnel at this mission.

card.name: The Traveler (Transcendent Explorer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}2 Physics {SD}Science When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, place him on the bottom of his owner's deck.

card.name: Tomalak (Irate Commander)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer Commander: Terix. At the start of each of your turns, you may stop your {rom} personnel present to reveal the top card of each player's deck.

card.name: B'tanay
card.text: When you play this ship, remove all the cards in your discard pile from the game.

card.name: Sphere 634
card.text: When this ship is about to move between an {AQ} mission and a {DQ} mission, do not add 2 to the span total of those missions.

card.name: U.S.S. Enterprise-D (Personal Flagship)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you complete a mission requiring Honor or Leadership, if this ship is at that mission, score 5 points (or score 10 points if that mission requires both).
